snippet: Sal Pane, the chief safety officer of Bio-Recovery Corporation, which cleaned Dr. Craig Spencer’s home, was accused of mortgage fraud in 2009 by the attorney general at the time, Andrew M. Cuomo.
abstract: Sal Pane, chief safety officer of hazardous-materials company Bio Recovery Corporation, was accused of fraud in 2009 by Andrew M Cuomo, who was attorney general at the time; Pane has been public face of company, which cleaned both apartment of Dr Craig Spencer, New York City's first Ebola patient, as well as bowling alley Spencer visited.
lead_paragraph: Sal Pane, the chief safety officer of Bio-Recovery Corporation, which cleaned Dr. Craig Spencer’s home, was accused of mortgage fraud in 2009 by the attorney general at the time, Andrew M. Cuomo.

headline.main: For Man in Ebola Virus Cleanup, a History of Fraud
headline.print_headline: For Man in Virus Cleanup, a History of Fraud
